alternative_title: Registration for waste carriers, brokers and dealers
licence_overview:
$!Contact the Scottish Environment Protection Agency (SEPA) to register as a waste carrier if you want to transport waste for your business, or buy and sell it.$!

You must also register to arrange for waste to be transported, disposed of or recovered.

You don't need to register if you only:

* transport your own household waste (not as part of a trade or business)
* move waste around your own site
* transport waste to or from the UK but not within it
* are a ferry operator, and your ferry takes vehicles carrying waste
* have a marine licence or marine licence exemption

You can get more help on whether or not you need to register by contacting [your local SEPA office.](http://apps.sepa.org.uk/map/index.html "Scottish Environment Protection Agency local offices"){:rel="external"}

##How to apply

Contact SEPA if your main place of business is in Scotland. Your registration covers the whole of Great Britain.

There are two types of registration - which one you need depends on who you are.

###Professional carriers of waste

You can apply for registration as a professional carrier of waste if you:

* are a charity or voluntary organisation
* only work with animal by-products, mining and quarry waste or waste from agricultural premises
* are a government department or local council
* only transport waste from your own business (and it is not construction or demolition waste)

^You can carry waste without being registered if you're on this list but you don't carry waste normally or regularly.^

You don't have to pay a fee.

You’ll get a letter confirming your registration. Your registration doesn’t need to be renewed.

###Carriers and brokers

If you aren't on the list of professional carriers you must register as:

* a carrier if you transport waste
* a broker if you arrange for waste to be recovered or disposed of
* both a carrier and a broker if you do both activities

^You will have to pay a fee of £158 for registration, and £42 if you want to add another category to your registration later.^

You get a certificate when you register. For £5 each you can also get credit card size copies.

Your registration will last for 3 years.

##Producing your registration certificate

You must produce your registration certificate, or the credit card size version, when asked.

##Fines and penalties

%If you transport waste but you aren't registered, you can be fined up to £5,000.%

If you are registered as a carrier but can't show your registration certificate or card when asked, you can be fined £5,000.

*[SEPA]: Scottish Environment Protection Agency
